value:
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">It was <choice>
          <sic>h  </sic>
          <corr>her</corr>
        </choice> marriage however that brought about her</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">peculiar relationship with <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-sjoh" key="Johnson, Samuel">Johnson</rs>. Had she been happy,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">she would never have known him as she did. It was through</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">him that she got what <rs type="person" key="Thrale, Henry">Thrale</rs> denied <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-hthr" key="Thrale, Hester">her</rs>-- stimulus, society,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">an outlet for her irrepressible curiosity and ambition.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But the <choice>
          <sic>freindship</sic>
          <corr>friendship</corr>
        </choice> between the old man and the young wife</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">went far <choice>
          <sic>depper</sic>
          <corr>deeper</corr>
        </choice> than <rs>Boswell</rs> allowed the world to guess.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Johnson was not merely a <choice>
          <sic>distingusihed</sic>
          <corr>distinguished</corr>
        </choice> guest at the dinner</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">table. He had the run of <choice>
          <sic>th</sic>
          <corr>the</corr>
        </choice> house. He knew <choice>
          <sic>th</sic>
          <corr>the </corr>
        </choice> dark passages</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">and the cupboards with their skeletons. Mrs Thrale told him</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">all her troubles. She turned to him when Queeney snubbed her;</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">when Mr Txxxxxx <add place="above">Thrale</add> took another mistress; when ruin <choice>
          <sic>threatned</sic>
          <corr>threatened</corr>
        </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">them; when one after another the children fell ill, and</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">died. "What shall I do? What can I do? has th flattery</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">of my mxmxmxmxmmxmmmxxxmmx <choice>
          <sic>freinds</sic>
          <corr>friends</corr>
        </choice> made me too proud of my own</l>
